abstract: An answer in the Q&A column on the Circuits pages on Thursday about plans by Microsoft to stop issuing security updates for consumer versions of its Windows XP operating system misstated the date of the change. Microsoft will stop the updates on April 8, 2014 — not on April 14, 2009.
snippet: An answer in the Q&A column on the Circuits pages on Thursday about plans by Microsoft to stop issuing security updates for consumer versions of its Windows XP operating system misstated the date of the change. Microsoft will stop the updates on A...
lead_paragraph: An answer in the Q&A column on the Circuits pages on Thursday about plans by Microsoft to stop issuing security updates for consumer versions of its Windows XP operating system misstated the date of the change. Microsoft will stop the updates on April 8, 2014  not on April 14, 2009.

abstract: At a mogul retreat, there was sympathy for Yahoo’s founder and new questions about Microsoft’s judgment.
snippet: At a mogul retreat, there was sympathy for Yahoo’s founder and new questions about Microsoft’s judgment.

headline.main: From the Inside, Jerry Yang Looks Out for Yahoo
headline.print_headline: An Insider Looking Out For Yahoo

abstract: With InBev winning its battle for Anheuser-Busch, Yahoo bashing the latest offer from Microsoft and Waste Management making an unsolicited run at rival Republic Services, it may seem as if unsolicited and hostile deals are on the rise. But data provided by Thompson Reuters suggest otherwise.
lead_paragraph: With InBev winning its battle for Anheuser-Busch, Yahoo bashing the latest offer from Microsoft and Waste Management making an unsolicited run at rival Republic Services, it may seem as if unsolicited and hostile deals are on the rise. But data provided by Thompson Reuters suggest otherwise.

headline.main: Hostile Tendencies, or Just a Few Big Feuds?
